channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024010472
item.description:
Report X-2024010472

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-07
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found in the Damages Area wet and torn open. It did not have any hazardous markings, so I thought it was water/rain from that day. However, I felt a burning sensation on my wrists and discovered the liquid was battery acid. It was an undeclared HazMat and a SDS was found to confirm its hazardous status. DescribePack: The FedEx Office box was torn open and soiled. There were plastic bags of plastic Christmas ornaments spilling out (inner packing). There were also three Non-HazMat items inside, but they got battery acid on them. The battery was inside a plastic shopping bag. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I found a SDS for the battery despite being sent Standard Domestic Residential and lacking any hazardous indications on the box. I isolated the package and processed it after knowing it was hazardous.

item.title: Report E-2024010122
item.description:
Report E-2024010122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-06
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NOF experienced a UN1992 Pro Form Lacquer Thinner Fast 19122 release from a 5-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of cardboard on the floor due to a puncture caused by other freight as a result of improper loading. The release was contained to cardboard. The damaged pail and impacted cardboard were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010173
item.description:
Report X-2024010173

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PREVIOUSLY DAMAGE AND REPACKED IN ANOTHER FACILITY. WHEN ARRIVED HERE THERE WAS A LEAKAGE DUE TO POORLY REAPACKED AND LACK OF DAMAGE PROCESS. DescribePack: LEAKAGE DUE TO OPEN CLOSURES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO HAZMAT CAGE IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND ABSORVENT WAS USED TO CLEAN THE SPILLAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024010220
item.description:
Report X-2024010220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 1 plastic pail of Trupower dishmachine detergent all purpose 5-gallon was found wet on side. Upon inspection found that the lid was loose resulted to leakage. Part of the lid was pushed upward allowing leakage. DescribePack: Plastic pail lid was loose resulted to leakage. Part of the lid was pushed upward allowing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010241
item.description:
Report X-2024010241

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was leaking on the IC belt badly. A manager put it inside a red tote along with a HazMat bag. He then moved it to the HazMat Cage. DescribePack: One plastic jug lost its cap and spilled its entire gallon out. The box was badly soiled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager put it in a red tote and HazMat bag before moving it to the HazMat Cage.

Report X-2024010210

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer with stains and brought to the damage area for inspection where it was put in a plastic bag inside a container in case of leakage. DescribePack: Upon inspection the caps were loose on both gallons causing them to leak soiling and staining the exterior of the box in various spots DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic Hazmat box ,placed in a drum and taken to the Hazmat cage

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the overhead sortation hazmat trap shute and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One of the jugs in the box was leaking contents from under the cap, even though the cap was on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010251
item.description:
Report X-2024010251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010251 SequenceEvent: The box was brought from Orlando local inside a hazmat tote with a hazmat bag leaking. While inspecting it was discovered that a gallon of ZEP calcium remover had loose cap causing it to leak. DescribePack: The box was brought from Orlando local inside a hazmat tote with a hazmat bag leaking. While inspecting it was discovered that one gallon of ZEP calcium remover had loose cap causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed inside a hazmat bag and tote straight and then the cap was tightened. 2. X-2024010270 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the unload and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The cap was loose on 1 jug and came off of another jug in the box, causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010307
item.description:
Report X-2024010307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HazMat arrived in a repack box with one side wet and torn away. It was put in a red tote and HazMat bag until it could be processed. DescribePack: Someone had repacked the HazMat from an earlier date. One cap was broken off and a jug was leaking. One side of the box was soiled and torn apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A red tote and HazMat bag were used to isolate it from others. It was then placed inside the HazMat Cage.
